thread.title: Jeremy McConnell accuses Stephanie of living off her baby
thread.title_full: Jeremy McConnell accuses Stephanie of living off her baby | Daily Mail Online

author: Kate Thomas for MailOnline
title: Jeremy McConnell accuses Stephanie of living off her baby
text:
Stephanie Davis has welcomed son Caben-Albi into the world as a single mother.
But her ex-boyfriend Jeremy McConnell has urged the former Hollyoaks star to give him the paternity test he longs for, and blasted the brunette for 'parading' her son around in a bid to paint herself as the victim of their toxic romance.
The former CBB star's short-lived romance with Stephanie came crashing down just a few weeks after their time on the reality show last Spring, with the pair splitting for good following an almighty row in April.
Scroll down for video
Speaking out: Jeremy McConnell has urged Stephanie Davis to give him the paternity test he longs for, and blasted the brunette for 'parading' her son around
Just a few weeks later, Stephanie called Jeremy to reveal she was expecting a baby - and the Irish hunk says he was thrilled, but didn't want to risk getting back together with her.
Reflecting on the possibility of being a father, he told The Sun Online : 'I do believe I am the father. I want the baby to be mine, I can see a resemblance.'
The 26-year-old insists he never said the baby wasn't his and he just wanted 'reassurance', claiming there was infidelity on both sides of the relationship and alleging that Stephanie had been with other men at the start of April last year.
Bold claims: The 26-year-old insists he never said the baby wasn't his and he just wanted 'reassurance', claiming there was infidelity on both sides of the relationship
Jeremy did concede, however, that his 'wandering eye' did nothing to alleviate their jealous rows.
If it turned out the baby was his, the tattooed star insists he would be 'delighted' and would do everything in his power to remain cordial with his ex.
In his first official interview since Caben-Albi's arrival Jeremy went on to blast Stephanie's 'horrible' treatment of the baby son.
The reality star believes she's milking it to get magazine deals and freebies, as well as influencing public opinion and painting herself as a powerful, single woman.
He lamented: 'She’s parading him around like he was the FA Cup. Stephanie is living off me and the baby, simple.'
Harsh: In his first official interview since Caben-Albi's arrival Jeremy went on to blast Stephanie's 'horrible' treatment of the baby son
He told The Sun Online: 'She’s parading him around like he was the FA Cup. Stephanie is living off me and the baby, simple'
MailOnline has contacted Stephanie's representative for comment.
Meanwhile, Stephanie took to social media to share a sweet snap of little Caben-Albi all bundled up in towels.
The lovestruck Quote: : 'Bath Time... My Love.. My Life.. My Everything'.
It comes as Jeremy, who has long denied being the father of Stephanie's three-week old baby, is set to tell his side of the tale in a live interview with This Morning on Wednesday.
Teasing the chat, Phillip Schofield said: 'Stephanie Davis maintains that he's the father to her newborn son but can Jeremy McConnell get the proof he needs and is he ready to be a dad?'
Stephanie has vowed to undergo a paternity test upon her baby's arrival and in a recent interview with OK! magazine she stated: 'The paternity tests in the process of being arranged, but any tests that happen will be dealt with privately.'
TV appearance: It comes as Jeremy, who has long denied being the father of Stephanie's three-week old baby, is set to tell his side of the tale in a live interview with This Morning on Wednesday
Jeremy has countered: 'I am delighted that Steph has safely had the baby, of course if he is my son I will absolutely step up and do what I can to support him.'
Last week, Stephanie proved she is clearly enamoured with her baby son as she chatted in a sweet video for OK! magazine, in which she told readers she 'can't wait to share their journey'.
The brunette beauty gave birth to her son on January 13 at Liverpool Women's Hospital weighing in at 6lb 10oz following a 48-hour labour.
Stephanie uploaded a photo of her carrying her baby in his car seat two weeks ago, as they made their way out of the maternity suite at a hospital in Liverpool.
She captioned the sweet snap: 'We did it little one... By far my favourite chapter yet... (sic),' followed by a red heart emoji.
The actress has admitted she can't wait to get started on the first chapter of the rest of her life with her son, and has thrown herself into life as a new mother.
Cute: Stephanie took to social media to share a sweet snap of little Caben-Albi all bundled up in towels. The lovestruck Quote: : 'Bath Time... My Love.. My Life.. My Everything'
